sentences: Kaksikud, vend ja õde on ühte nägu.
Mina oma õega küll ühte nägu ei ole.
Tal on hea nägude mälu, hea mälu nägudele.
context: The Estonian word 'sarnased' is the plural nominative form of the adjective that means similar or alike. It describes things that have resemblance or similarity to each other. In the provided dictionary examples, it's used to describe people who look like each other, such as twins having the same face ('kaksikud... on ühte nägu') - meaning they are very much alike in appearance.
